stories.title: Tomatoes that produce as much Vitamin D as eggs

stories.text:
I've read many times in comments here on HN that the speed of your database is the biggest bottleneck for your server-side web app. Therefore, the speed of your server-side programming language is not important (or less important).

I asked this question in 2019 (3 years ago) and many HN posters said the database was more likely to be a bottleneck than the server-side programming language. Does this still hold true in 2022?

(Here's the original discussion from 2019: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=20123659)
stories.title: Ask HN: Database-driven web apps â€“ is the database still a bottleneck?

stories.text: I created this tool for myself and have been using it every morning for more one year. The list is updated every 10 minutes and new links are added at the top. The links are chosen based on certain criteria like minimum votes and comments.
stories.title: Show HN: Top links from HN, Reddit, Producthunt and Techmeme on one page
Palaeospondylus: Long-standing mystery of vertebrate evolution solved with Xrays
Building a Data Platform from Scratch at Collectors
Wisconsin man celebrates eating McDonald's Big Mac every day for 50 years
Customer support management platform Assembled lands $51M

stories.text: I am interested in finding a job at a company that is having a positive impact in the world. I think this probably rules out FANG (MAMAA?) companies. Does your work make at least a small contribution to a better world? If so, where do you work?
stories.title: Ask HN: Recommend employers with positive social impact
